Disagree with the idea that you can't recruit entrepreneurs to lead a game-changing company without a fat payout at the end. The ones you want aren't in it for the money https://twitter.com/chrissyfarr/status/996801250418044928 …

12/ Early on take the smartest money you can get (ideally past founders/CEOs). I'd cut my valuation in half just to get it. It can be the diff between life & death. A local maxima or a global maxima in terms of impact. Ideally, people who can empathize with you. It's worth it.

T3: We should NOT be afraid to talk about #mentalhealth. ✔️Everyone can play a role✔️Learn to use respectful languageA little sensitivity goes a long way. #HCLDR #mentalhealth #WTFix pic.twitter.com/BlzBRqhEAt

T3: As a society, we have a tendency to name things, and tend to get carried away with "labels" - detaching ourselves from the very people we are talking about. We need to:1. realize this is happening2. educate/ teach alternative words & phrases #HCLDR #mentalhealth #WTFix https://twitter.com/hcldr/status/996556839796989952 …

I still hold that "I'm glad you're here" is the single most powerful thing to say to anyone who has struggled with suicide on any level.  #hcldr https://twitter.com/NAMIAustin/status/996555904131698688 …
T2: easier - asking people what they want from life. Not focusing on the condition, the treatment... #hcldr https://twitter.com/hcldr/status/996553819902259200 …

@hcldr T2: Language is powerful. Context, intention and knowing your audience count for a lot in everyday chats; the level of responsibility shifts up many notches when you're a clinician. #HCLDR #mentalhealth #WTFix @HCLDR @NAMIAustin pic.twitter.com/pZXItsiogp
T1: Labels are for jars, not people. #EndTheStigma to cure the illness. #mentalhealth #HCLDR #WTFix pic.twitter.com/9PkuLXnJfy
@hcldr T1 The American culture of “just suck it up and deal with it” drives misconceptions about mental health issues and deters people from seeking help. #hcldr #EndtheStigma
